From Catalonia we want to contribute directly as a new member state to forge and strengthen this common space of freedom, progress, solidarity and justice that we want the European Union to be. We will exercise democracy: we will vote, we will decide and we will stay in the European Union to improve it.

name: Gilles LEBRETON
text: - Mr. President, Turkey is in the throes of a major settling of scores following the failed coup of last summer. President Erdoğan has indeed undertaken to repress all those who frighten him: 40,000 people have been arrested and 90,000 officials sacked. Among the suspects are around 40 Turkish NATO military personnel who have sought political asylum in Germany. Not content with having flouted all the principles of criminal law, Erdoğan is now engaging in heinous blackmail against the European Union. He threatens to break the March 2016 agreement on migrants if Germany does not hand over the 40 soldiers to him. Ms. Merkel negotiated this fragile agreement behind the backs of her partners. It is right that she should suffer the consequences today. Unfortunately, France will suffer them too, like other European states, because the possible opening of the Turkish migration valve would overwhelm the whole Union. It is high time that France regained its sovereignty to control its borders and negotiate itself the treaties it wants, with whom it wants.

name: Sotirios ZARIANOPOULOS
text: NI). - Mr President, recent statements by the Quartet of European Governments and the Greek Government SYRIZA / ANEL, as well as the other parties that voted for the third memorandum, on when its evaluation will be closed, express conflicting interests within the Union and jokes about good European Union and bad International Monetary Fund but for the people everyone agrees: new memorandum package with labor jungle and fourth memorandum, after 2018, with spending cut for damn surpluses, reduction of the tax-free of the poor, new crunch of pensions. It is not the government that is being blackmailed, but the people, by all, so that they do not react. Grexit, elections, calls for national unity for another massacre. The government agreed. She only cares how heroically she will place them, not if, but when she will legislate the measures. The other parties are pressuring her to hurry. The poor farmers in Greece who are struggling with taxes, high costs, low prices, Common Agricultural Policy that subsidizes large farmers by uprooting the rest, set up a blockade throughout Greece. The only way for the people to survive is to generalize them, it is the social alliance for overthrow.

name: Francisco de Paula GAMBUS MILLET
text: - Mr President, Commissioner. Today I want to bring to this plenary session a story that began in Barcelona and has reached Lesbos. A Catalan volunteer, who is in one of the refugee camps in this territory, asked her mother to send her all the thermal and mountain clothes that she could collect, due to the very low temperatures they are experiencing. Her mother began to send WhatsApp messages to her friends and this message became a chain that has exceeded all expectations. The result, in just a few days: five trailers with more than a thousand boxes of collected clothes, which are already distributed in Lesbos. This is a good expression, one more, I am sure, of the solidarity of Europeans, but it radically clashes with the inaction of the States. State governments are unable to find a solution that guarantees the rights of those fleeing the tragedy of war. We are all called to help urgently. For this reason, if the challenge for these families in Barcelona that simply started with a WhatsApp has crossed borders and has become a reality in a few days, the States and other institutions, but especially the States, will they not be able to help, aid and host refugees?

name: Viorica DĂNCILĂ
text: - Mr President, protests are taking place in Romania this evening and at this very moment, where violence has taken place among the police, but also among those present at the protest. Firecrackers and stones were thrown at law enforcement with the desire to provoke the authorities to produce casualties. This did not happen, but I think this discredits those who contributed to these protests, having members in the hall here who support this. Moreover, the information appeared that the National Anticorruption Directorate, the main anti-corruption body, wants to open an investigation against the Prime Minister, members of the government, civil servants from the Ministry of Justice who participated in drafting the two normative acts. This is incomprehensible and unacceptable in a Member State of the European Union. I believe that misinformation is no more important than democracy in Europe.

name: Marek JUREK
text: - Mr Chairman!Ladies and gentlemen,French socialist authorities took steps to introduce drastic censorship of statements in support of the lives of unborn children.The European Union authorities - so eager to investigate real or imaginary threats to human rights - took it with tacit approval.As a result, the first - and still extreme - draft prepared in the National Assembly was still radicalized in the Senate.These repressive actions against the French who defend the first of human rights - the right to life of the weakest - are a gloomy testimony to the totalitarian drift of modern Europe, and the tacit approval that I called on President Timmermans to stop compromising the current authorities of the European Union.

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: - Mr. President, for twenty-five years I have been advocating good neighborly and friendly relations between Croatia and Slovenia. However, today I must warn the Commission of a series of unacceptable actions and statements that we hear from the Slovenian government and its ministers. The Slovenian government continues to build the wire on the border between Croatia and Slovenia completely unnecessarily and in completely unnecessary places. Also, I must say that the Minister of Agriculture continues to announce that we will be exhausted about one case that the Commission has solved and, I believe, solved, the case about Teran. However, the culmination is a statement by the foreign minister, who says that if Croatia does not accept arbitration over the border in the Piran Bay, Slovenia will make it more difficult for guests to travel to tourist destinations on the Croatian coast and elsewhere in Croatia. These are unacceptable statements, these are not good neighborly statements, this is not a friendship between neighboring countries and which has bound a lot in the last hundreds, hundreds of years. I expect the Commission to think carefully about what it will do in the coming months.

name: Xabier BENITO ZILUAGA
text: - Mr President, two pieces of news coincide at the same time: on the one hand, it is being decided whether the Garoña plant in Burgos should remain open for another twenty years; On the other hand, the construction of a nuclear waste warehouse is approved at the Almaraz nuclear power plant in Cáceres. Portugal has already submitted a complaint and we hope that the European Commission will resolve against this nonsense. Is it a coincidence? Nothing further. These two pieces of news follow a common thread. They follow a strategy: the strategy of the Popular Party government to extend the life of the already aging nuclear park of the Spanish State. Autonomous and technical governments, citizen platforms and, of course, also from this House we are going to continue to oppose this serious threat; a threat led by a puppet power government; a government that wants to continue granting benefits to the oligopoly, but is not capable of creating a social bond that prevents deaths from energy poverty. As this badge says, «Garoña, ni de coña».

name: Csaba SÓGOR
text: - Mr President, the Head of State of Romania recently stated before the Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe that the protection of national minorities is a model in Romania, as he has been elected Head of State as a minority German. I do not think it is exemplary that the German minority of more than half a million has now shrunk to a few thousand, that the minority law promised before accession has been sabotaged, that the use of their mother tongues is punished, their symbols are restricted, their community property and real estates are re-nationalized, and the autonomy promised in the 1918 Gyulafehérvár resolution has been denied ever since. In any case, the degree of the situation of minorities can be measured by how the community itself or its elected representatives evaluate it. The situation of national minorities in a country should be judged by the minorities themselves. In our case, not the first man of the Romanian state to state several times before his election: he declares himself to be of German descent but of a Romanian sentiment.

name: Nicola CAPUTO
text: - (IT) Mr President, ladies and gentlemen, the spiral of the economic crisis has made the lives of millions of European citizens precarious. Italy has paid a very high price in terms of job losses. The latest ISTAT surveys decline disturbing data: youth unemployment rates that exceed 40% in a general unemployment rate of 12%, data much higher than those of the Eurozone. The creation of new jobs must become the absolute priority for Italy and for Europe. A grand action plan must be put in place, a plan that includes investment reforms in social housing, physical and digital infrastructure and educational infrastructure. The Italian government is doing its utmost to improve the conditions of the country in terms of development and creation of new jobs, but it is clear that Europe's decisive contribution is needed. We need a more flexible and expansive economic policy, which can allow our country to overcome difficulties and effectively combat poverty and unemployment. Also and above all this is how Europe is built.

name: Notis MARIAS
text: ECR). - Mr. President, yesterday marked 21 years since the 1996 crisis in Imia, where three members of the Greek Armed Forces, Lieutenant Christodoulos Karathanasis, Lieutenant Panagiotis Vlachakos and Chief Hector Gialopsos fell for their homeland. On Sunday, January 30, 2017, the Turkish Armed Forces made another extremely provocative move that is a direct challenge to the territorial integrity of Greece. A Turkish rocket fired by the commander of the Turkish Armed Forces, General Hulusi Akar, together with the commanders of the Turkish Army, Navy and Air Force violated the Greek territorial waters and approached the Greek islets of Imia. And all this, at a time when the Turkish Air Force is violating Greek airspace every day. Today alone, 138 violations have taken place, while the Turkish leadership is constantly questioning Greece's sovereign rights in the Aegean, culminating in Erdoğan's provocative and dangerous statements on the revision of the Lausanne Treaty. The Greek people do not tolerate the challenges of Turkey and Erdoğan and respond to them with "Molon Lave".

name: Jozo RADOŠ
text: - Mr. President, according to the report of the European Court of Auditors from 2016, European seaports make up 3/4 of the total traffic with third countries of the European Union.However, the report of the European Court of Auditors also reveals that there is no strategy for the development of European Union seaports.The court analyzed 37 projects, of which only 18 projects were implemented in the observed 13 years, and other projects did not have an ex ante analysis, which led to inefficient projects and a large waste of money.The Court warned in 2012 that consolidation of European maritime transport rules is needed and I therefore call on the European Commission to finally propose to the European Council and the European Parliament a strategy for the development of maritime transport in the European Union.

name: Paloma LÓPEZ BERMEJO
text: - Mr President, I want to echo an initiative of LGTB associations and unions by which the Government of Spain is asked to end the exclusion of people with HIV from public service. It is regrettable that public institutions perpetuate stigma and discrimination against this group, when they should be pioneers in defending the rights of people with HIV at work, as stated by the ILO in its Recommendation No. 200. I ask the solidarity of the European Parliament with this fight, but I also call on the European Union to act accordingly. The principle of non-discrimination is inscribed in the Charter of Fundamental Rights and in the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union and we must use instruments such as the Directive on equal treatment in employment in a broad sense, in line with the United Nations, to break down these barriers. We cannot allow outdated prejudices to remain in force in the legislation of the Member States, contradicting one of the most fundamental rights of people with HIV: the right to decent work and without discrimination.

name: Cristian Dan PREDA
text: - Mr President, there are times in the life of a nation when its future is decided in the streets. This is happening now in Romania, after the anti-corruption fight was blocked by the PSD-ALDE government, an organized criminal group that took over the country. That's what the greatest Romanian writer of today called him. Tonight, half a million citizens are shouting their indignation in more than 50 cities. Their words are harsh: defiance, cowardice, red plague. But hope did not die. "We want Europe, not to be humiliated!" cried the crowds. "The law is a law for all, not for thieves!" That's what the street says. It is a huge peaceful revolution. Recently, irresponsible PSD leaders mobilized the ultras from the football galleries to discredit the protests in Bucharest. I ask the European Socialists to renounce their colleagues in Romania and to demand the withdrawal of the ordinances of the PSD-ALDE government. I call on the European Commission to intervene, as it did in 2012, to protect the rule of law!

name: Victor NEGRESCU
text: - Mr President, because the debate on the situation in Romania is taking place in just a few hours, I will be speaking tonight on another equally important subject. I am referring here to the budget and the economic measures for 2017 because I am sure that all the political forces in Romania are consistent in ensuring the economic stability of the country. Therefore, I want to assure all our partners that, in terms of the parameters set by the European Commission, our budget for 2017 fully meets all the objectives assumed. Therefore, within the budget we have provided funding for a number of important measures, such as increasing health and education incomes, increasing the minimum wage and the pension point, doubling student scholarships and free transport by rail. All these projects are designed to ensure the well-being of citizens in key areas in key projects and, especially, our desire to fit into the general European budget for 2017. We have come out of the logic of austerity and we are convinced that having and being consistent together all political forces, Romania's economic stability can be maintained.

name: Ángela VALLINA
text: - Mr President, last week I was in Tenerife to hold several meetings on environmental concerns, which, unfortunately, are many on the islands. One of the groups with whom I met was the Canarias por un tierra Sostenible platform, which is mobilized to avoid further deterioration of the rich heritage that these islands have in their ecosystem. A new threat looms over the Canary Islands in the face of the soils law projects and the misnamed "green islands law", which we already denounced to the European Commission from the United Left in this Parliament a few months ago. The European Commission itself has recognized that, despite the declaration of regional interest by the Canary Islands authorities, the projects must meet the protection requirements established by European environmental law. From the European Parliament we will continue to be vigilant on this issue and the European Commission has already opened an investigation into these bills. I appeal to the Government of the Canary Islands to rectify. Let us act from here, from the Union. And I also appeal to the precautionary principle so that we do not have to regret further irreparable damage to the valuable natural environment of the Canary Islands when it is, as always, too late.

name: Daniel BUDA
text: - Mr. President, the PSD government led by Liviu Dragnea and Sorin Grindeanu managed to throw Romania into immeasurable chaos by secretly amending the Criminal and Criminal Procedure Code. Thanks to the PSD government, Romania is today on the verge of becoming an unpredictable, unfrequented country, a country in which investors will have reserves to invest. In an extremely complicated political context, when foreign policies are reset and new axes are created from Europe to America, or from Africa to Asia, the PSD government leaves Romania out of the game, and, I could say, by fate. I believe that an emergency ordinance should be issued immediately to repeal what has been adopted in this area and that the debate should be moved to parliament, where the decision should be taken only after consulting all the factors and institutions involved, but also those with expertise in the field. Last but not least, I publicly demand the resignation of the PSD government as an absolutely necessary measure for Romania's credibility.

name: Tomáš ZDECHOVSKÝ
text: - Mr President, Commissioner, the European Union is founded on respect for human rights, the dignity of every individual, and it must be made clear at all times that this is no phrase, that these are the values that we will defend when necessary.I would like to point out one case of violation of the rights of European Union citizens.This is the case of the Czech humanitarian worker Petr Ježek, who was sentenced this weekend to more than 20 years in prison on the basis of a fabricated accusation of anti-state activities and espionage.Given the conditions in Sudanese prisons, such a sentence is practically equivalent to the death penalty.Europe as a whole must unite and put enough pressure on Sudan to free Petr Ježek as soon as possible.The rights of the citizens of the European Union are inalienable and their violation is to be defended across the states of the European Union.

name: Jiří POSPÍŠIL
text: - Mr President, I would like to talk about one of the forms of serious crime in Europe, and that is the smuggling of animals from the eastern part of the European Union to Western countries. It is the smuggling of hundreds of thousands of dogs and cats, so-called pets, and we have spoken here several times in plenary about the need to take action against this smuggling. I would like to call on the Commission here to speed up the preparatory measures that have been discussed here in plenary, to talk more, and to prepare proposals for possible registers of dogs and cats. And for law enforcement authorities at European level to cooperate more. I would like to inform you that in the Czech Republic there is now a draft veterinary law in Parliament, which is to introduce the registration of dogs, which is to give clear conditions for chipping and for the public register. But if we do not address this issue at European level, then national action will be only half-hearted and we will not eradicate this form of serious crime on the European continent.

name: Ramón Luis VALCÁRCEL SISO
text: This closes this point.
